content: hey friends D I'm Scotty here glad to have you with me now as many of you know
I started crafting years ago and marrying that with my D&D game and I
haven't looked back since we have a wonderful crafting community
so many people got in on this and really enjoy it and one of those seminal crafts
that I did was this purple worm video that's playing behind me and it got so
many people to try this out because it's like oh I can use these cheap materials
a glue gun and make something really cool and that was what I was trying to
get across in my you know especially in my earliest videos as I've gone along
I've evolved a bit with more materials and things but yeah I mean the whole
point of the craft is that use whatever material you have you don't have to use
what you know this this crap material that crap material use whatever you have
and I think this really exemplifies the fact that you can do that that you can
use really cheap materials and make something cool and over the years I've
seen so many cool purple worms that people have shown me and it's just wow
it's just so cool knowing that you influence people or that they got
inspired more importantly inspired to craft themselves so what I thought I'd
do is I'm working on my newest purple worm video that's coming up soon I'm
kind of updating it and that's gonna be out soon but I thought it'd be fun to go
back and show you some of the other purple worms that other people have made
inspired by this video so let's look at those and enjoy you know the diversity
and the fun I think they really get across the fun and the ease of the craft
you know with a glue gun and all the cheap materials that you can make this
really cool thing so let's look at these pictures of people who have enjoyed the
craft over the years and have made the purple worm you know possibly is their
first craft into this crafting greater crafting world
you
